meanings.definition: To ride faster or farther than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outrode her friend in the race.
meanings.sent2: He always outrode his competitors in the cycling competition.
meanings.sent3: The little rabbit outrode the tortoise in the friendly race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outrode any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The champion outrode all expectations with his incredible speed.

meanings.sent1: She outrode all her previous records in the last race.
meanings.sent2: He outrode his fear and took the leap of faith.
meanings.sent3: The superhero outrode all villains in the final showdown.
meanings.sent4: His courage outrode any doubts he had about succeeding.
meanings.sent5: The explorer outrode the storm and reached the safety of the shore.
